com.viper.projections

Class MapPoint

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.viper.projections.MapPoint
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable

    public class MapPoint
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable
    A point representing a location on the planet, can be projected or non-projected values in double precision values.
    Version:
    1.0, 06/15/2003, Original version
    Author:
    Tom Nevin (TomNevin@pacbell.net)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      double lat 
      double lon 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MapPoint()
      Constructs and initializes a point at (0.0, 0.0).
      MapPoint(double lat, double lon)
      Constructs and initializes a point at the specified (lat, lon) location in the coordinate space.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int compareTo(java.lang.Object o) 
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
      Determines whether an instance of MapPoint is equal to this point.
      double getDistance0(MapPoint pt) 
      double getLat()
      Returns the latitude coordinate of the point in double precision.
      double getLon()
      Returns the longitude coordinate of the point in double precision.
      boolean isOutsideLimit() 
      boolean isSame(MapPoint pt1, double resolution) 
      void set(double lat, double lon) 
      void setLat(double lat) 
      void setLon(double lon) 
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this point and its location in the (lat, lon) coordinate space.
      void translate(double dlat, double dlon)
      Translates this point, at location (lat, lon), by dlat along the latitude axis and dlon along the longitudinal axis so that it now represents the point (lat + dlat, lon + dlon).

        clone, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

        public MapPoint(double lat,

        Constructs and initializes a point at the specified (lat, lon) location in the coordinate space.
        Parameters:
        lat - the latitude coordinate
        lon - the longitude coordinate

    • Method Detail

      • setLon

      • translate

        public void translate(double dlat,
                      double dlon)
        Translates this point, at location (lat, lon), by dlat along the latitude axis and dlon along the longitudinal axis so that it now represents the point (lat + dlat, lon + dlon).
        Parameters:
        dlat - the distance to move this point along the latitude axis
        dlon - the distance to move this point along the longitude axis

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Determines whether an instance of MapPoint is equal to this point. Two instances of MapPoint are equal if the values of their lat and lon member fields, representing their position in the coordinate space, are the same.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - an object to be compared with this point
        Returns:
        true if the object to be compared is an instance of MapPoint and has the same values; false otherwise

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of this point and its location in the (lat, lon) coordinate space. This method is intended to be used only for debugging purposes, and the content and format of the returned string may vary between implementations. The returned string may be empty but may not be null.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string representation of this point
